title: [K-12] Social-Educational Integration Competency Enhancement Course Through School Library Self-Assessment: Building Civicness and Educational Ecosystems

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of school library operations, experience with educational policies and self-assessment tools, foundational knowledge of community educational resource integration, and basic comprehension of the relationship between citizenship education and social systems
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices (BYOD) to combine online modules with face-to-face workshops, strengthening reflective practice competencies through case sharing based on school library evaluation experiences. Particularly focusing on enhancing civic capabilities and building sustainable educational ecosystems through collaboration among educational institutions, and exploring ways to improve educational systems by linking with local cultural resources

learning_goals: The current operational status of a school library can be systematically diagnosed, and improvement directions for educational community development can be derived from a citizen participation perspective.
Apply the Improve Your Library self-assessment process to design a school development plan integrating the library, curriculum, and community

Learners share evaluation results (5 performance indicators) with 3 peer institutions, develop 1 collaborative project proposal for building an educational cooperation network, and propose 3 improvement action plans reflecting reflective practice strategies from the perspective of civic competency enhancement
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
